body.description: 43" 1080P LED HDTV 3 x HDMI (HDMI 1 shared with MHL) clear QAM MEMC 120 illuminating the color and clarity of 1080P resolution is delivered on the X438BV-FSRR 43" LED HDTV. With 3 HDMI ports (HDMI 1 is shared with MHL), picture quality and streaming access is available at its fullest potential. Clear QAM conveniently delivers cable channels to your HDTV without the need for an antenna. With a MEMC 120 (Motion estimation and Motion compensation), all action-packed sequences will flow smoothly from frame to frame for the ultimate experience. Enjoy every moment of the auto enhanced picture quality especially for all your favorite sports, video games, and movies packed with action.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Excellent TV LED TV With sharper contrasts of light and darks, LED display delivers a vast array of rich colors, ensuring that moving images have never been so pleasing to the eyes. LED Display offers a lifelike picture, complete with bright colors and crisp images. Multiple HDMI Ports Sceptre’s X4 has a wide variety of input and output ports, ranging from digital inputs, such as multiple HDMI, to analog outputs, such as Component and VGA. Easily enjoy all of your devices without taking a single step. Mobile High-Definition Link (MHL) MHL allow streaming of contents from your compatible smartphone or tablet to Sceptre TV, which capitalize on the visually enhanced picture quality.

TV Friendly Energy Star Products that are ENERGY STAR-qualified prevent greenhouse gas emissions by meeting strict energy efficiency guidelines set by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and the U.S. Department of Energy. The ENERGY STAR name and marks are registered marks owned by the U.S. government, as part of their energy efficiency and environmental activities. Native 1080p Resolution 1920x1080 With Full HD 1080p Resolution, Sceptre X4 delivers 2 million pixels of high quality resolution, twice as much as a standard HDTV. Enjoy your favorite shows and movies in vivid detail. USB Port Let’s you view your pictures as a slideshow or listen to your favorite music via the USB port. Just insert your flash drive into the USB port for the ultimate entertainment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great TV in it's price range.
reviews.reviewText: Pro's: After fine tuning all the settings to my viewing specs, the picture is very sharp. I wouldn't use this TV as my main viewing platform, but for the price, and for a bedroom, I highly recommend it.Con's: Viewing past a 45 deg angle the video seems to be SLIGHTLY washed out. Viewing directly, the video is sharp. Mine is mounted on a mount/swivel, so that's not a problem. I always run in vivid mode, not in standard mode.The audio is on the tinny side. Even adjusting the base, doesn't help much. It does not have an arc/hdmi port, nor does it have an optical out port. Again, you have to consider the price. I have a pair of Edifier R1280T Powered (42w) Bookshelf Speakers. There are RCA inputs on the back of the TV. I would recommend external speakers but you may find the TV audio ok for you. It's not gross, just a personal choice.The remote doesn't have a backlit. Again, consider the price. The TV is connected to a cable wireless box, so I use the cable remote that has a backlit.Final overview: For the price, I could not find another TV that performed as well. I would definitely buy this TV again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy set up!!!!!
reviews.reviewText: The TV arrived a day early. I was not at home. Lucky the UPS driver left it at my back covered porch, it was raining! As soon as I got home in the evening I brought it inside. It was late so I didn't open it until today. A good neighbor friend came over and she & I took it out of the box and screwed the legs on. Sceptre even provided a little screw driver! I plugged my Roku Streaming Stick Plus into the HDMI-1 spot with the SUB port hook up for wireless. Then I hooked up my Blue Ray into the HDMI-3 spot, then I hooked up my VCR/DVD combo into the red, white & yellow ports. Then we lifted this very light weight TV onto my cabinet and plugged her in. Using the TV remote I pressed power. NOTHING happened. After realizing maybe it was the batteries they sent were too old, I switched to fresh Energizer batteries and it worked! My Roku came on the screen right away. I scrolled down to settings and clicked onto Roku remote to run my TV and it was all set up in seconds! I played something on Netflix....GREAT! Then Amazon Prime....Great! Then I turned to YouTube.....GREAT! The picture quality on this set is really GOOD and the sound is fantastic! This Sceptre 43"TV is replacing a 39" LG HD LED TV that died on me last week after having it for only 4 years and 2 months! The LG was twice the price as this one, and side by side right now I have to say I can't see much difference in picture quality. The LG sounded very surround sound though, but this TV has great volume to me, even my friend thought it was way too loud. I see no need for any added speakers or a sound bar at all. I'm glad I got this for the sale price but at under $250 for a TV of this size and quality it's worth it. I cut the cord 4 years ago and now only stream and I love it!! This was the easiest TV ever to set up! My friend & I are both senior citizens and this was a snap! I love Amazon.com I ordered this Friday, 9-28-18 and got it delivered to my back door on Tuesday, 10-2-18. Amazon Prime is the way to go baby! Now I'm back to streaming movies, movies, movies! LOVE IT!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nothing fancy but it gets the job done
reviews.reviewText: I use this only as an output for my PC and it works great. I have had no issues with display, everything is displayed properly up to 1920x1080 with no pixel/ratio problems. Picture is crisp and clear. The sound however is absolute trash. You can make it a little better by adjusting the sound settings, but even a cheap soundbar would be an improvement. I also don't like the two stands on either end and would have much preferred a central stand as having the stands on the sides limits where you can place the TV, but this is a minor complaint as I have removed them and put the TV on a mount anyway. TV is lightweight making mounting and just handling in general easier. It doesn't have all the modern features of a pricier TV, but it fulfills my needs and I'm happy with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars When you just want it to show a picture without all the "smart" nonsense
reviews.reviewText: A definite upgrade from my previous gaming tv, a unit from '05 or so and showing it's age. I use headphones for all sound output to avoid bothering my family (though they refuse to return the favor) so can't really speak for sound quality. It was surprisingly hard to find a tv WITHOUT all the built in smart thisandthats, but I'm not gonna sit through updating my tv before I have to sit through updating my games. For someone who doesn't need a super ultra-def curved million inch voice activated whatever, this unit gets the world saved, bosses beat, and shows/movies binged at a reasonable price. Overscan was easy to turn off in the menu as well, so I don't have to deal with half my Skyrim menus being cut off. Bless you Sceptre.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Don't waste your money!!!!!!
reviews.reviewText: The picture is on average with all other sets but the sound is absolutely awful!!!! I contacted the sellers made a few suggestions and after I tried them for a few days and called back about a replacement since it was new, their response? Oh, "I'm sorry sir, you are now 2 days past your available 30 day return window" They refused to help me anymore except to say I could search for a tv repair shop that may accept my warranty. Astalavista. I know many people like me on occasion read these reviews and ignore them. I did after reading the sound was bad but please don't waste your money. You will not be happy with this tv!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!UPDATE: The TV has now died completely. It has gone from terrible to worse. No power at all. I'm sure the warranty process will be just as bad as this piece of crap TV!Update: Looks like amazon has dumped on me also. I requested their help as the seller has been totally non-helpful and amazon has left me hanging. This is really out of character for amazon and I am very disappointed!
